results.title: Bobby and the Birchip Leisure Centre
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: The Birchip Leisure Centre is the social hub of Birchip township and surrounds. In addition to providing clubrooms for the local football, hockey, netball, golf and tennis clubs, the leisure centre also plays host to social events and functions. What is key to the centre is the fact that it is community built and funded - everyone in the local area collaborated to raise money and build the facilities. Here the manager, Bobby Liston, gives a personal view of this important place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development

results.title: Bob the gambler = Bob le flambeur
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Melville, Florence Melville, Productions Cyme and L'Organisation Generale Cinematographique
results.brief_description: Bob, a retired bank robber and compulsive gambler masterminds a raid on the casino at Deauville to cover his gambling debts. An underworld comedy of manners unfolds as Bob’s morality is tested through the double-crosses of the other protagonists and an unforseen murder. The film is a homage to American cinema, namely John Huston, through the underlying motif of failure. Its gritty, free-wheeling style with its jump-cuts, jazzy score and visual quotes predates the French New Wave. Melville was only able to afford three lights when shooting the film which meant that most of the backgrounds had a hazy appearance. This effect became a trademark of the film and made Henri Decae, a director of photography, in high demand. Cast includes Isabel Corey, Roger Duchesne, Daniel Cauchy and Guy Decomble. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Bob the builder
results.brief_description: Join Bob the builder, his faithful cat Pilchard and his gang of building machines: Scoop the Digger, Muck the Bulldozer, Dizzy the Cement-mixer, Lofty the Crane and Roley the Steamroller in their world of fun, adventure, construction, muck and mayhem. Included on the tape are 4 exciting tales: ‘Scoop saves the day’; Bob and his team are called on to save the day when the town is damaged by a heavy storm; ‘Travis paints the town’; Spud the mischievous scarecrom plays a trick on Travis that nearly ends in disaster; ‘Bob saves the hedgehogs’; even hedgehogs need to cross the road safely, so they enlist the help of Bob and his machinery; ‘Pilchard in a pickle’; Pilchard the cat has gone missing. Where could she be? Is she in one of the pipes that Bob has carried off to lay? Written by Diane Redmond.

results.title: Bob Roberts
results.creator_credit: Tim Robbins, Forrest Murray, Working Title Films, PolyGram, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Released just before the start of the Clinton presidency, this political satire was prescient comment on the corruption of American politics by the media-savvy celebrity culture. Constructed as a pseudo-documentary, the film follows the campaign bus of a candidate running for a senatorial seat in Pennsylvania. Bob Roberts is a young, wealthy, well-connected rebel conservative with a penchant for folk music who appropriates liberal touchstones of the 1960s and 1970s for his own agenda. On the surface he is a sincere believer in the restoration of such intangibles as national pride and family values, but the longer he is followed about by documentary filmmaker Brian Murray, the more the candidate is revealed as a textbook case of cynicism and contempt. Written and directed by Tim Robbins. Cast includes: Tim Robbins, Giancarlo Esposito, Ray Wise, Alan Rickman and Gore Vidal, with appearances by John Cusack, Peter Gallagher, Susan Sarandon, James Spader and Fred Ward.

results.title: Bob Parish interview
results.brief_description: This interview forms part of the Sport and Screen project which will be exhibited at Screen Gallery at Federation Square. It hopes to document the oral history of the developing relationship between sport and the screen in Australia in the last half of the twentieth century. The interview with Robert (Bob) James Parish CMG, OBE is conducted by Daryl Dellora. Bob Parish was born on 7 May 1916 and played a long and distinguished part in Victorian and Australian cricket over many years. In particular he was Chairman of the Australian Cricket Board(ACB) from 1975-80 during which time a major development in international cricket took place - that of the creation of World Series Cricket(WSC). The new ‘television friendly’ game of WSC could not develop without the assistance of the ACB and it was in negotiating this relationship between the ACB and WSC that Bob Parish played a central role.

results.title: Bob le Flambeur = Bob the Gambler
results.brief_description:
Bob, a retired bank robber and compulsive gambler masterminds a raid on the casino at Deauville to cover his gambling debts. The film is a homage to American cinema, namely John Huston, through the underlying motif of failure. For instance, the ending of ‘Bob le Flambeur’ is very similar to ‘Beat the Devil’ and the scene where one of the protagonist dies in a horse enclosure is reminiscent of ‘The Asphalt Jungle’. What is astonishing is how much the gritty, free-wheeling camera style predates the French New Wave. Everything is already here, the jump-cuts, jazzy score and visual quotes. This is the kind of film that we want to make! exclaimed the young and rebellious Francois Truffaut in 1955. Godard acknowledged Melville’s influence, giving him an extended cameo in ‘A bout de souffle’ (‘Breathless’). Melville’s influence has also been acknowledged by foreign filmmaker such as Quentin Tarantino and John Woo. Melville only had a small budget for this film and could only afford three lights. The lack of lighting being a hindrance for depth of film, most of the backgrounds appear soft on the screen. This effect became a trademark of the film and made Henri Decae a director of photography in high demand.

Credits: Producer, Florence Melville ; director, Jean-Pierre Melville ; writers, Jean-Pierre Melville, Auguste Le Breton ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Eddie Barclay, Jo Boyer ; costumes, Ted Lapidus.
Cast: Isabel Corey, Roger Duchesne, Daniel Cauchy, Guy Decomble, Simone Paris, Andre Garet, Claude Cerval, Colette Fleury, Gerard Buhr, Howard Vernon.

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.

results.title: Bob Dylan: Don't Look Back
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Albert Grossman, Ashes and Sand and Pennebaker Associates
results.brief_description: An intriguing film biography which captures Dylan during his 1965 English tour. It includes many private moments as well as the public performances. The cast features Joan Baez and Donovan, and tracks include, “Subterranean Homesick Blues”, “The Times They Are A’ Changin’”, and “It’s Alright Ma”.

results.title: Spotlights: Bob Connolly
results.brief_description: An Australian film director, cinematographer and author. He is best known for his documentaries produced over the past 30 years, including The Highlands Trilogy (1983) and Rats in the Ranks (1996). More recent films include Facing the Music (2001) and Mrs Carey’s Concert (2011).

constellations_primary.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_primary.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.description: Bob Connolly is an Australian director, cinematographer and author. He’s best known for his documentaries, produced over the past 30 years, including The Highlands Trilogy (1983) and Rats in the Ranks (1996). More recent films include Facing the Music (2001) and Mrs Carey’s Concert (2011). Bob discusses the art of documentary making and acknowledging unconscious bias.
description_for_label: Bob Connolly is an Australian director, cinematographer and author.
